intro: Astragalus arrectus var. kelseyi, commonly known as the Kelseyi milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub habitats. This variety is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife.
